description.narrative:
- Expansion of Argentine Export Base: FV's ability to continue developing its export base is dependent on the required permanent working capital needs to sustain an adequate and diversified level of stock to supply different markets abroad. The wide portfolio of products require FV to allocate larger amount of resources in order to better attend each market it supplies and enhance its competitive position abroad.
- Creation of Consumer Surplus: FV's cost optimization and energy efficiency improvements is expected to eventually translate into more competitive prices to end users, primarily within the construction sector. More competitive prices for building materials will benefit the housing sector.

Founded in 1921, FV S.A. (FV or the Company) is a second-tier family-owned and managed company and Argentina's leading producer of brass and metal fixtures for baths and kitchens.
FV is well known to IFC, in 1998 IFC approved a $16 million financial package to FV, in 1999 IFC committed a $9 million financing package to FV Ecuacobre, and more recently in 2008, IFC committed another project with FV for up to $20.0 million.
FV will embark in an investment program of about $20 million for the next two to three years, that would mainly comprise: (i) permanent working capital to maintain a well supplied wide portfolio of products to attend an exigent demand on a timely basis; (ii) improve operational efficiencies, including savings on a better use of energy resources; and (iii) completion of the environmental upgrades suggested by the IFCs action plan.
